memberdef.name: CLOUD_BACKEND_DEFINE
memberdef.initializer: \ static struct cloud_backend_config UTIL_CAT(_name, _config) = \ { \ .name = STRINGIFY(_name) \ }; \ \ static const struct cloud_backend _name \ __attribute__ ((section(".cloud_backends"))) __attribute__((used)) = \ { \ .api = &_api, \ .config = &UTIL_CAT(_name, _config) \ };

detaileddescription.para: The cloud backend is connecting to the configured cloud vendor.
The cloud backend is connected to the cloud.
The cloud backend got disconnected from the cloud.
The cloud backend has established the appropriate resources for the connection.
An error has occurred in the cloud backend.
Data has been sent to the cloud.
Data has been received from the cloud.
The device is not yet associated with the user. Pairing requested.
Pairing with the user has been carried out.
FOTA has started.
FOTA has finished.
The underlying FOTA process has a pending image erase.
The FOTA image erase has finished.
FOTA download progress event.
FOTA error.

briefdescription.para: Cloud events that can be notified asynchronously by the backend.

detaileddescription.para: The connection was closed by the cloud
The connection is no longer valid
Miscellaneous error

briefdescription.para: Quality of Service for message sent by a cloud backend.

detaileddescription.para: Endpoint used to send messages to cloud.
Endpoint used to update the cloud-side device state.
Endpoint used to delete the cloud-side device state.
Enpoint used to request the cloud-side device state.
Endpoint used to pair the device with a user.
Cloud backend is not initialized.
Invalid parameters in cloud connection request.
Host cannot be found with the available network interfaces.
A backend-specific error.
Error cause cannot be determined.
MQTT RX/TX buffers were not initialized.
Invalid private key
Invalid CA or client certificate
Miscellaneous certificate error
Timeout; typically occurs when the inserted SIM card has no data
Connection process has already been started.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* cloud_evt_handler_t) (const struct cloud_backend *const backend, const struct cloud_event *const evt, void *user_data)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct cloud_backend *const backend, const struct cloud_event *const evt, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: cloud_evt_handler_t

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to user defined data that will be passed on as argument to cloud event handler.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a cloud backend. Performs all necessary configuration of the backend required to connect its online counterpart.

parameterdescription.para: Handler to receive events from the backend.

briefdescription.para: Uninitialize a cloud backend. Gracefully disconnects remote endpoint and releases memory.
Request connection to a cloud backend.

detaileddescription.para: The backend is required to expose the socket in use when this function returns. The socket should then be available through backend->config->socket and the application may start listening for events on it.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a cloud backend structure.

simplesect.para: connect result defined by enum cloud_connect_result.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a cloud backend structure.

simplesect.para: 0 or a negative error code indicating reason of failure.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a cloud backend structure.

simplesect.para: 0 or a negative error code indicating reason of failure.

briefdescription.para: Optional API to ping the cloud's remote endpoint periodically.

simplesect.para: 0 or a negative error code indicating reason of failure.

briefdescription.para: Helper function to determine when next keep alive message should be sent. Can be used for instance as a source for poll timeout.

simplesect.para: Time in milliseconds until next keep alive message is expected to be sent.
-1 if keep alive messages are not enabled.
0 or a negative error code indicating reason of failure.

briefdescription.para: Calls the user-provided event handler with event data.
